Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Burrito Bowls

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a delicious and hassle-free meal, look no further than these Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Burrito Bowls! Perfect for busy weeknights or meal prepping for the week ahead, this recipe combines tender, shredded chicken with hearty black beans, sweet corn, and flavorful spices, all cooked to perfection in your slow cooker. The best part? You can customize your bowls with your favorite toppings like cheese, avocado, and fresh cilantro to create a satisfying dish that everyone will love. With just a handful of ingredients and minimal prep time, this recipe is not only easy but also packed with flavor and nutrition. Let’s dive into how to make these mouthwatering burrito bowls that will transport your taste buds straight to Mexico!

Ingredients

boneless, skinless chicken breasts

Ensure that the chicken breasts are thawed before cooking for even cooking. If you prefer, you can substitute with boneless, skinless chicken thighs for a richer flavor. For added moisture, consider marinating the chicken in lime juice and spices for a few hours before adding to the slow cooker.

black beans (canned)

Rinse and drain the canned black beans to reduce sodium content. If you're using dried beans, soak them overnight and cook them separately before adding them to the slow cooker. You can substitute black beans with pinto beans or kidney beans for a different texture.

corn (frozen or canned)

If using frozen corn, there's no need to thaw it beforehand; just add it directly to the slow cooker. For a fresh taste, you can use fresh corn on the cob, just cut the kernels off. If you want a bit of sweetness, consider using sweet corn.

salsa

Use your favorite brand of salsa, or for a fresher taste, make homemade salsa using diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and lime juice. You can substitute salsa with diced tomatoes with green chilies for a milder flavor.

rice (uncooked)

Use long grain white rice or brown rice for a healthier option, but note that brown rice may require additional cooking time and liquid. For a flavor boost, consider using lime juice or broth instead of water to cook the rice.

chicken broth

If you want a richer flavor, use low-sodium chicken broth or homemade broth. You can substitute with vegetable broth for a vegetarian version or use water in a pinch, though it will lack depth.

chili powder

Adjust the amount of chili powder to your heat preference; you can also mix in some smoked paprika for a smoky flavor. If you don't have chili powder, use a mix of cayenne pepper and paprika.

cumin

Cumin adds an earthy flavor; toast the seeds before grinding them for a more intense flavor. If you don't have cumin, coriander can be a substitute, though it will change the flavor profile slightly.

garlic powder

Garlic powder provides convenience and a mellow flavor. For a fresher taste, consider using minced garlic (2-3 cloves) instead. If you are allergic to garlic, you can omit it or use garlic-infused olive oil.

salt

Taste your dish at various stages of cooking to avoid over-salting. If using canned beans or broth, be mindful of their sodium content when adding salt.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will provide the best flavor. Adjust the amount based on your spice tolerance; for a kick, consider adding cayenne pepper.

toppings (cheese, avocado, cilantro, sour cream)

Customize your toppings based on preference. For a healthier option, use Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. Fresh herbs like cilantro can be added at the end for brightness, while avocado adds creaminess. You can also try lime wedges for an extra zesty touch.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare Ingredients

    Gather all your ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1 can of black beans (rinsed and drained), 1 cup of corn (frozen or canned), 1 cup of salsa, 1 cup of uncooked rice, 2 cups of chicken broth, 1 tsp each of chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Also, prepare your desired toppings like cheese, avocado, cilantro, and sour cream.

  • Step 2: Layer Ingredients in Slow Cooker

    Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker. Then, add the black beans, corn, salsa, uncooked rice, and chicken broth.

  • Step 3: Add Seasoning

    Sprinkle the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper over the ingredients in the slow cooker. This will enhance the flavors of the dish.

  • Step 4: Mix Ingredients

    Using a spoon, stir everything together until well combined. Make sure the rice is submerged in the broth for even cooking.

  • Step 5: Set Slow Cooker

    Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours. If you're in a hurry, the high setting is a great option.

  • Step 6: Shred Chicken

    After cooking, use two forks to shred the chicken directly in the pot. Mix it back into the rice and beans to combine all the flavors.

  • Step 7: Serve and Garnish

    Spoon the mixture into bowls and top with your choice of cheese, avocado, cilantro, and sour cream. Serve warm and enjoy!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the chicken breasts for the slow cooker?

Simply place the boneless, skinless chicken breasts directly into the slow cooker. You don’t need to cut them up; they will cook and become tender as they simmer.

What should I do if I can't find black beans in a can?

You can use dried black beans instead! Just soak them overnight and cook them separately before adding them to the slow cooker, or choose another type of canned bean like pinto beans.

Can I use minute rice instead of uncooked rice?

Yes, but you should add it during the last 30 minutes of cooking instead of at the beginning, as minute rice cooks much faster than regular uncooked rice.

What if I don’t have chicken broth?

You can substitute with water, but using broth adds more flavor. You could also use vegetable broth if you prefer.

How can I tell when the chicken is done cooking?

The chicken is done when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). However, since this is a slow cooker recipe, it will be tender and easy to shred after the cooking time is up.

What are some safe ways to handle raw chicken?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw chicken to avoid cross-contamination. Use separate cutting boards for raw meat and other ingredients.

What is the best way to shred the chicken after cooking?

Use two forks to pull the chicken apart. It should shred easily after being cooked for several hours.

Can I add other vegetables to the mix?

Absolutely! You can add bell peppers, zucchini, or any other vegetables you like. Just chop them into bite-sized pieces.

How should I store leftovers?

Allow the burrito bowl to cool, then store it in an airtight container in the fridge for 3-4 days. You can reheat it in the microwave or on the stove.

What toppings should I use for my burrito bowl?

You can customize your burrito bowl with toppings like shredded cheese, diced avocado, fresh cilantro, sour cream, or even a squeeze of lime for added flavor!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free and can be easily adapted for various dietary needs. To make it dairy-free, simply omit or substitute the cheese and sour cream with avocado or a dairy-free alternative. For a low-carb option, replace rice with cauliflower rice or quinoa. Ensure to use low-sodium black beans and chicken broth for a healthier choice.

Pairings

For a complete meal, serve the Burrito Bowls with tortilla chips and guacamole on the side. A refreshing drink like a Mexican lager or a fruity margarita pairs beautifully, while non-alcoholic options like lime-infused sparkling water or horchata are great as well. For an added kick, consider serving with sliced jalapeños or a spicy hot sauce.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the burrito bowls in vibrant, colorful bowls to enhance the visual appeal. Layer the toppings neatly on top for a beautiful presentation. Consider garnishing with extra cilantro or lime wedges for a pop of freshness. Offer a variety of toppings on the side, allowing guests to customize their bowls according to their preferences.

Description

A hearty and flavorful bowl filled with tender chicken, beans, rice, and fresh toppings, all made effortlessly in your slow cooker!

Ingredients

  • boneless, skinless chicken breasts: 1.5 lbs
  • black beans (canned): 1 can
  • corn (frozen or canned): 1 cup
  • salsa: 1 cup
  • rice (uncooked): 1 cup
  • chicken broth: 2 cups
  • chili powder: 1 tsp
  • cumin: 1 tsp
  • garlic powder: 1 tsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • toppings (cheese, avocado, cilantro, sour cream): as desired
